column21: There has to be a convincing value of belonging to the association unlike the forgoing. Let us learn from other professional bodies. Surely, we need to do better. The face of our office speaks volume. It's even a turn off and you wonder if there is relevance of sacrificing the little we earn in this difficult time to pay for membership. Truth be told, something somewhere is not adding.
column23: Off course I am willing but value to money is key. What exactly should prompt me to always remain a paid up member? This is the big question to be answered. The day we are all going to face it and answer the question asked, that will be the turn around of members coming in big numbers to always remain paid up

column27: Re inventing the will is not a way to go. Let's basically learn from other professional bodies and do better. There is no headache of debating issues of structures but learn from. our friends and move. Once we have where to start from then it becomes easier to look at doing it better. But for now, office for the secretariat is an issue, staff much to be desired, face of the secretariat in terms of publicity Is something else, furniture etc all these are big issues. No pride of us paid up members walking to visit our professional body unfortunately. Sad.

column27:
1. For Members to be highly involved in the EAZ activities, it would be nice for EAZ to formally request all organizations that have paid EAZ members to formally release them for such activities. At times, if the organization does not formally release employees for EAZ activities, it becomes difficult to get permission from immediate supervisors to attend such activities.
2. Consider adjusting the time of EAZ activities to working hours.
3. Consider having zoom links for those who are unable to attend physically meetings of an important nature.

column27:
Annual General Meeting should be emphasized.

Open student Chapters Across Zambia in key Universities (offering economics or business related programs) and monitor progression. ,Consider the fees to be reasonable for students,(I propose a low fee like k100 to k150.).

For the professionals it can be according to income bracket. 

Push for an act of parliament to make it mandatory for Economists  related jobs e.g. working at Bank of Zambia  to be members of the institute.

 Open Branches in other key provinces for membership development focus and commitment (if their is no funding ,it can start under voluntary program).

 I do believe membership benefits can be enhanced by fostering collaboration & Knowledge -Sharing.

Recommendation for board appointments for members according to specialization is key to motivate loyal members.

 Optimizing industry events ,more presence and engagement digitally, encourage discounts for early membership payments.eg 5% if they members pay before time

Continuous provision of education resources on Zambia economy and proposed reforms .

Push for members to make payment towards building own offices for a period of 2 years and provide minimum amounts according to membership structure.

column21: As an Economics and Finance student, I'm interested in the activities of the Zambian Economy and how it performs in reference to other economies around the world. The economic and financial activities and policy implementations by decision makers is of utmost importance to me and EAZ offers a platform where such information is disseminated and engages with the general public through forums. In addition to the above, EAZ also brings me closer to like minded people and professionals in my fields of interest.
column23: Similarly to question 19 & 20 as i stated, as an Economics and Finance student on a path to become a fully realized Economist, I'm interested in the activities of the Zambian Economy and how it performs in reference to other economies around the world. The economic and financial activities and policy implementations by decision makers is of utmost importance to me and EAZ offers a platform where such information is disseminated and engages with the general public through forums. In addition to the above, EAZ also brings me closer to like minded people and professionals in my fields of interest.

column27:
I'd recommend for EAZ to have unique and engaging programs specifically tailored to mentoring and nurturing student members in regards to their interests offered by EAZ and to offer internship programs for paid up student members to assimilate hands-on experience in the field of Economics and related fields as is the association's name "Economics Association of Zambia".
I'd also recommend EAZ to collaborate with students by encouraging establishment of Student Chapters within the Universities and conveying the stipulated benefits on the website to paid up student members of the University chapters.

column27: The Senior Economist level need to be actively engaged in debating policy issues, critic the same and offer counter proposals. This could be around matters of national interest such as a plan to increase tax. This level can be engaged to empirically test and determine the impact such would have on employees' disposable income for example. In general, a more inclusive approach to this level would help. Further, this level would also expect some recommendations to any government position that require knowledge of economics. Such would act as incentives and allow for willingness by members to meet their yearly subscriptions obligations.
